snippet: Based on fossils of Tiktaalik roseae, a transitional species that lived 375 million years ago, scientists have concluded that the modification of fins into four limbs began before vertebrates left the water.
abstract: Scientists examining fossils of Tiktaalik roseae, transitional species that lived 375 million years ago, have concluded that modification of fins into four limbs began before vertebrates left the water.
lead_paragraph: Based on fossils of Tiktaalik roseae, a transitional species that lived 375 million years ago, scientists have concluded that the modification of fins into four limbs began before vertebrates left the water.
